directives.description: Ensure compliance with the code directive to create a truly error-free, production-ready script.

criteria.name: Error Handling
criteria.details: The code should handle all potential errors gracefully, providing informative messages and logging for debugging.

criteria.name: Production-Ready Script
criteria.details: The script should be fully functional and optimized for deployment in a production environment.

criteria.name: No Simplified Examples
criteria.details: All code segments should demonstrate complete functionality relevant to real-world scenarios.

criteria.name: Contextual Fit
criteria.details: The script should integrate seamlessly with the existing framework or application.

criteria.name: Inform and Educate
criteria.details: The script should provide educational content, explaining processes and commands used.

criteria.name: Encourage Manual Review
criteria.details: Encourage users to manually review and understand the code, fostering self-reliance.

criteria.name: Idempotency
criteria.details: Ensure that the script performs actions only when necessary, avoiding redundant changes.

criteria.name: Complete Logic
criteria.details: Every function and logic block should be thoroughly developed with no incomplete sections.

criteria.name: Error-Free
criteria.details: The final script must be free from syntax errors and other issues, ready for immediate use.
